org.jcvi.jillion.internal.trace.chromat.ztr.chunk

Enum Chunk

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Chunk>
      • org.jcvi.jillion.internal.trace.chromat.ztr.chunk.Chunk
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<Chunk>

    public enum Chunk
extends Enum<Chunk>
    The Chunk is the basic unit of the ZTR Structure. Each Chunk consists of a type, some metadata and then the data.
    Author:
    dkatzel
    See Also:
    ZTR SPEC v1.2

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      BASE
      The BASE Chunk contains the actual base calls for this Chromatogram.
      CLIP
      CLIP contains the suggested quality clip points (0- based).
      COMMENTS
      Implementation of the ZTR TEXT Chunk.
      CONFIDENCES
      The Confidences Chunk is an implemention of ZTR 1.2 format for CNF4Chunk which encodes the quality values for all 4 channels.
      POSITIONS
      The POSITIONS Chunk contains the positions of the bases (peaks)stored as ints.
      SMP4
      SMP4 is the chromatogram scan points for all 4 channels of trace samples.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • BASE

        public static final Chunk BASE
        The BASE Chunk contains the actual base calls for this Chromatogram.

      • POSITIONS

        public static final Chunk POSITIONS
        The POSITIONS Chunk contains the positions of the bases (peaks)stored as ints.

      • CLIP

        public static final Chunk CLIP
        CLIP contains the suggested quality clip points (0- based).

      • CONFIDENCES

        public static final Chunk CONFIDENCES
        The Confidences Chunk is an implemention of ZTR 1.2 format for CNF4Chunk which encodes the quality values for all 4 channels. The format of the data is: the confidence of the called base followed by the confidences of the uncalled bases. So for a sequence AGT we would store confidences A1 G2 T3 C1 G1 T1 A2 C2 T2 A3 C3 G3. Any call that is not A, C, G or T is stored as a T.
        See Also:
        ZTR SPEC v1.2

      • SMP4

        public static final Chunk SMP4
        SMP4 is the chromatogram scan points for all 4 channels of trace samples. The order of channels is A,C,G,T. It is assumed that all channels are the same length.

      • COMMENTS

        public static final Chunk COMMENTS
        Implementation of the ZTR TEXT Chunk. Any information decoded from this chunk will be set as Trace comment which can be obtained via Chromatogram.getComments().
        See Also:
        ZTR SPEC v1.2

        public static Chunk[] values()

    System.out.println(c);

        protected int readLength(InputStream inputStream)

      • parseData

        protected abstract void parseData(byte[] unEncodedData,
                                  ZtrChromatogramBuilder builder)
                           throws IOException
        Performs the actual conversion from the data stored in the chunk into the appropriate format and SETS the data to the given ZtrChromatogramBuilder object.
        Parameters:
        unEncodedData - the actual bytes to parse (including any formating bytes).
        builder - the ZtrChromatogramBuilder to set the data to.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there are any problems parsing the data.
